original_title: Sometimes I Wish I Was On a Desert Island
overview: As the world learns to live again in the midst of the pandemic, for many Arabic-speaking LGBTQ+ people living in Montreal, this is just a period of time like any other. When youâ€™ve fled homophobic violence in your home country and endured a painful migratory journey, or you still face social prejudices stemming from intercultural and intergenerational conflicts, surviving social isolation is nothing new.
title: Sometimes I Wish I Was On a Desert Island
